list_definition.definition: happening at once and without delay

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: His immediate successor was Bill Jones.

list_ex_of_english: Such response-produced cues could come, for instance, from immediate proprioceptive byproducts of the response as well as its more remote effects.
The immediate economic effect of high turnover rates was to disrupt production.
The radical limits of immediate memory must be explained in terms of biocognitive brain architecture.
All this would have been outside the immediate scope of the article.
An immediate corollary, which will be useful below, is the following.
The presence of hydrops would suggest inadequate fetal cardiac output, which should prompt consideration of delivery and immediate surgery.
Their immediate reaction to the slump was to retrench and ride the crisis.
In the early design phase changes occur frequently, because the synthesis between the designer's idea and the engineering and ergonomic constraints is not often immediate.
